contentrichtext.text: Article [[David Simpson]] listed on [[WP:VFD]] Apr 26 to May 3 2004, consensus was to delete. Discussion: Vanity. Reads like a resume. [[User:UninvitedCompany|UninvitedCompany]] 22:36, 26 Apr 2004 (UTC) *Delete. Common name makes it hard to verify, but even the accomplishments claimed on his cv don't sound too notable. But we should probably also de-link his name, and most the other names at [[Ehmphasis]], or we'll keep repeating this. [[User:Niteowlneils|Niteowlneils]] 23:12, 26 Apr 2004 (UTC) *Delete. [[User:RickK|Rick]]'''[[User talk:RickK|K''']] 23:22, 26 Apr 2004 (UTC) * Delete. [[User:Postdlf|Postdlf]] 8:28 27 Apr 2004 (UTC) *Possibly keep. [[User:Fatal Ruminate|Fatal Ruminate]] Redundant article, subject already covered in ''''Who's Who in Canada''''. Minor celebrity in Toronto only, not a well-known author. Most likely added due to Ehmphasis connection or due to charity work. *The court case may be worth keeping if it became a famous case, but other than that I don't see anything to make him interesting. [[User:Wiwaxia|Wiwaxia]] 07:22, 28 Apr 2004 (UTC) *Delete: vanity, nobody in particular. The so-called "landmark case involving libel/slander on Usenet", [[Simpson vs. Savoie]], yields 0 hits. Makes me think it wasn't much of a landmark. [[User:Wile E. Heresiarch|Wile E. Heresiarch]] 08:24, 1 May 2004 (UTC) ''End discussion''
